intro: Psychotria aurea, commonly known as the golden psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Psychotria aurea is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecological interactions of its native habitats.
